intro: Rhyncholacis jenmanii, commonly known as the Jenman's spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a low, sprawling shrub with small, oval leaves. Its flowers are clustered in complex inflorescences called cyathia, a characteristic feature of the Euphorbiaceae family. Rhyncholacis jenmanii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
